page.title: 12THE FIGHTING OF THE FIRES
page.content: It takes a long time to put out moorland fires because there are not many water supplies.The only supplies are reservoirs,lakes,water tanks, streams, and brooks. The main problem is getting at the water. If it is in boggy ground two firemen can carry a small pump to the water. If they are a long way from water there is an appliance that carries a mile of hose. Sometimes a fire break is used that is where a path is cleared in front of the fire to prevent its progress. This does not always work on the moors for the fire can travel underground in the deep peat.Firemen always work in pairs for the smoke is so thick that you could become overcome by the smoke or lose your way.
